title: Capacitors - 2 in parallel are in series with 2

content.question: What is the equivalent capacitance of the set of capacitors shown in the figure?

choices.label: <math alttext="C sub 1, end sub, plus, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator C sub 2, end sub, plus C sub 3, and denominator 2, close parenthesis, plus C sub 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="C sub 1, end sub, plus, open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over C sub 2, end fraction, plus the fraction 1 over C sub 3, close parenthesis, to the negative 1 power, plus C sub 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over C sub 1, end fraction, plus the fraction 1 over C sub 4, close parenthesis, to the negative 1 power, plus C sub 2, end sub, plus C sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over C sub 1, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator C sub 2, end sub, plus C sub 3, end fraction, plus the fraction 1 over C sub 4, close parenthesis, to the negative 1 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over C sub 1, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator C sub 2, end sub, plus C sub 3, end fraction, plus the fraction 1 over C sub 4, close parenthesis, to the negative 1 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
